topic.title: zerome2md - export/dump your ZeroMe posts to a markdown file
topic.body:
[zerome2md] can dump/export your ZeroMe posts to a markdown file (for backup or publish eleswhere).

Images are supported. Comments are not supported yet (patch welcome).

[Demo] of exported markdown file rendered by Jekyll (a static site/blog builder).

[zerome2md]: https://github.com/weakish/zerome2md
[Demo]: https://mmap.page/log/

topic.title: Which static site generator is most friendly to ZeroNet?
topic.body:
Is your zite generated via a static site generator?
If so, which static site generator do you use?
Any issue or best practice to share?

I googled zeronet with pelican and hugo, and found [issues](https://github.com/getpelican/pelican/issues/1928) on [them](https://discourse.gohugo.io/t/make-url-use-only-ascii-characters/7592) (not sure if these issues still exist today).

1523974219_1F9qtxgSgbkeJX7NT2BARwR8XCn1X.body: A lot of skinny people expected to gain weight on their 30s, but they failed.

1542422330_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2.body:
> [timelinehyperbot](#comment_28_12JYCt1Mj1Fa7GA9N67HAxP6NiBHVWK9GS): All email messages are encrypted and stored securely. Proton mail is about as secure as you can get... [...]

Any system, no matter how secure it is in theory, may have bugs in its implementation.

1544102354_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCF.body:
> [leftside](#comment_403_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): I think .json is easy to deal with from the view point of javascript and python programming. And db is for speed. Since ZeroHello search performance is faster than the local bash script grep through .json's.

.json file is easier to sync with different peers. Theortically ZeroNet could use some distributed database though.

> [blurhy](#comment_185_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK): Dumping comments needs to scan all json files. [...]

Thanks a lot for pointing out this. I should have used `ZeroNet/data/1MeFqFfFFGQfa1J3gJyYYUvb5Lksczq7nH/merged-ZeroMe/ZeroMe.db` instead.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_529_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): @weakish It is interesting, your demo page is nice looking, you edited the exported .md anyhow or i can just replace .md by .html? By the way the github description of the project missing an example on how to import the export .md file back to ZeroMe. Or is this tool built basicaly to do readable export of the posts and no import? Unsure if there would be some usage case for importing, if it would work and if not better for this purpose to backup user's zerome directory (ZeroNet/data/HUBID/data/user/USERID - IDs visible when one copy the URL which is under ones username link on ZeroMe)

I didn't edit the exported .md. I just put the exported markdown files and related jpeg files on GitHub, and [GitHub Pages](https://mmap.page/dive-into/gh-pages/) will "render" it automatically.

I wrote zerome2md for readonly export because I want to publish a copy of my zerome posts on clearnet.
Thus there is no import.

Though I can image some use cases for importing, for example, you want to edit existing posts or add new posts on your phone, but you do not have ZeroNet installed on the phone. Then you can open and edit the exported markdown file on the phone with some edtior. When you go back to your computer, import it to ZeroNet again. Potentially, it may even auto sync your ZeroMe posts to some external note taking application/service. So you can edit it on your phone easily (with mobile application of that note taking application/service). But it would be another project.

1556958282_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body: Yes, this is very confusing. Suddenly Firefox told me that the addons are not unverified thus disabled. I even did not upgrade Firefox. It is still the same version, and suddenly BANG!
And only ESR, developer editor and nightly can manually enable unsigned addons. WTF!
Hmm, it seems that Firefox forgot to renew their intermediate signing cert. This disables all addons. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1548973

1576434866_1CJc7iRKb8yncAkdF29t1M85mhfYE.body: Learn X in Y minutes is open source. So an alternative way  to download it via wget is clone the repo and build the site locally on your machine, then upload it to ZeroNet. [Instructions](https://github.com/adambard/learnxinyminutes-docs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.markdown#building-the-site-locally)

1603608731_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
The development of Zeronet is slow but all essential features are already implemented. So I am not going to switch.

However, I am interested to join an experimental network fork to try out new features.

1606040168_1AkCd6161a4erMEbe4998aX7Hnpd2.body: Anyone has tried running zeronet on ish (an iOS app providing a full linux shell (Alpine Linux))?

1611680008_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCF.body:
> [zonateam4622](#comment_35_1Fs7oXqGMju27ZzXFFJn4dLt11yrbg5HKs): does a static site is like zerosites Where the user can add something and not just the Admin ? 

Exactly the opposite. Only the admin/site owner can edit a static site. For example, ZeroTalk is not a static site.

Here is  [a list of popular static site generators](https://www.netlify.com/blog/2016/05/02/top-ten-static-website-generators/). Ballistically a static site generator takes some data and templates, and output static files (html & css & (frontend) js, etc.)

> [styromaniac](#comment_2931_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I'm wondering if Webflow is any good, but I code by hand.

Webflow is a SaaS solution. I'd prefer open source tools that I can run on my own machine.

> [c657clpuyu9qmkeu](#comment_2_1LS3ur69MC9WP8UMjAHCWYdfopv39kEfaJ): When you figure this out, please document and repost. I suspect many need help here.

I use Jekyll (no endorsement, just because it is the default option of GitHub Pages). And it turns out quite straightforward to deploy a Jekyll site on ZeroNet. The internal links need some extra attention, and become tricky if RSS is involved. I just wrote down [some notes about this][jekyll-zeronet].

[jekyll-zeronet]: http://127.0.0.1:43110/16XMwj6YRNqRHWbmSD8oxYUZCKfM1uzwP9/dive-into/jekyll-zeronet/

1611883036_1HyrFrFXUHZC58qLuFrjAXm2Jjkb3.body:
> [zonateam4622](#comment_49_1Fs7oXqGMju27ZzXFFJn4dLt11yrbg5HKs): good to know thanks .. The questions is Does exist a way fast to do that ? A cleanup ? or we need to go on Zerotalk click on Topic and see all of our Topic and 1 by 1 open see the 3 circle and Delete ,delete ,delete ,, and Dont fallow the Thread (unfalow etc etc ..) ?

You can edit your `data.json` directly, which is quicker but more dangerous (you may end up with an invalid `data.json`).
